item.title: Consistent Hashing
item.description: Consistent hashing idea was introduced in paper Consistent Hashing and Random Trees: Distributed Caching Protocols for Relieving Hot Spots on the World Wide Web which was released in the year 1997. Akamai distributed content delivery network uses the approach described in the paper. In 2007, consistent hashing was used in two published works Dynamo: Amazonâ€™s Highly Available Key-Value Datastore Last.fm Memcached client After that it has been used in many other distributed system like Cassandra, Riak etc.
